dialogues.text: Quail ditches the recorder and the "emergency case" into the drawer -- everything except the PISTOL. Quail approaches the door very cautiously (from the side out of the line of fire).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tensely) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is George Edgemar. I work for Rekall, Incorporated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned; incredulous) Rekall??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's difficult to explain... Could you open the door, please?  I'm not armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail opens it carefully, his gun at the ready, but out of view of the person at the door. A dignified-looking GENTLEMAN stands there, calm and pleasant, wearing an Earth-style business suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Quail.  May I come in?  I won't be offended if you prefer to keep the gun you're holding trained on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't see the gun, but somehow knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail does keep his gun trained on the man.  The man ente holding in his outstretched hand -- a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My card, Mr. Quail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail frisks him, then takes the card, glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- so you're Doctor George Edgemar of 'Rekall, Inc.'  So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said... this is going to be very difficult -- for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Quail... I'm afraid you're not really standing here at this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sat that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, you're not really here.  Neither am I.  We're both in the Memory Studio -- in the offices of Rekall, Inc. On Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to tell me that this is all part of some... artificially injected fantasy? That I never really left Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not quite.  We didn't give you this.  You're creating it yourself -- (pauses, choosing his words) Remember the option we offered you?  Intelligence agent? Something inside you liked that idea, fastened on it. What you're experiencing now is a free-form delusion that you yourself are fabricating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this shit you're giving me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not -- shit, Mr. Quail. It's the truth. (beat) I know it's very hard for you to accept, but you're having a schizophrenic reaction... we can't snap you out of the Narkadine.  You're in a world of your own fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how the hell can you be in my dream -- if you know it's just a dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been artificially implanted -- like the first part of your fantasy.  I'm actually monitoring your dream at a psychoprobe console. This is a last resort.  When somebody gets stuck in their own fantasy, we send in someone after them.  A specialist, like myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe a word you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid you'd think that. I'm sorry to have to do this, but you really are stuck. (calls out) Doctor Noel, would you come in now please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door starts to open.  Quail pivots and points his gun at the opening door. MELINA walks in, carrying a CLIPBOARD.  She looks at Quai with professional detachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Quail, I'm afraid it's all true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail is staggered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I tried to break through to you earlier, but you just molded me into your fantasy. Sometimes it takes Dr. Edgemar to get through to a client as tough as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wavering) So what's supposed to happen now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do exactly as we tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at him coldly) Somehow that doesn't appeal to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mr. Quail... try to cooperate.  You're having a schizophrenic embolism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can't get you out now... you may never come out of it. Your wife calls every day --

dialogues.speaker: QUAIL
dialogues.text: Even more suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is a fantasy, there'll be no real consequences when I pull this trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there will by consequences inside your mind.  Consequences that won't hurt me... but could be fatal to you. (beat) If you shoot me, you'll wipe me out of your fantasy -- I can't come back again.  Because to you, I'll be dead.  I can't help you get back to reality. You'll be stuck in permanent psychosis.

dialogues.speaker: QUAIL
dialogues.text: Trembling, holding the gun point blank in Edgemar's face.

dialogues.speaker: EDGEMAR
dialogues.text: Showing no fear of tension whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to lower the gun, Mr. Quail.  You're going to hand it to me --

dialogues.speaker: QUAIL
dialogues.text: Straining desperately to find the true "reality."

dialogues.speaker: TRIGGER OF GUN
dialogues.text: Quail's finger on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to do exactly what I tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail PULLS THE TRIGGER!

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF EDGEMAR'S HEAD
dialogues.text: We SEE the results of the gunshot from this angle only, and so BRIEFLY as to produce an almost SUBLIMINAL effect: the back of Edgemar's head blows off -- He collapses to the floor. Melina LEAPS at Edgemar's falling form and CLAMPS HER HAN over Edgemar's RIGHT HAND!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, Charles!  There's more of them in the hall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail spins toward the door just as it BURSTS OPEN.  A ma enters, firing, but Quail has fallen to the floor and returns the fire.  He staggers back out into the corridor and slams against the wall, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from hall) You've had it, Hauser!  Throw out your weapon if you want a past!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina is still crouched by Edgemar's body, holding his HAND for some reason.  Her CLIPBOARD dangles by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) There's an explosive in the clipboard!  He has a dead-man switch in his hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeezing Edgemar's hand shut with one of hers, she holds up her other wrist -- to show that the CLIPBOARD IS BOUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Hauser?  We haven't got all night!  Hauser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail (Hauser) SHOOTS OFF the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens it I come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail takes the CLIPBOARD from Melina and eases himself t the side of the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll put in a word with the big boys.  Maybe you'll just get exile to Venus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Here comes the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail reaches around the corner and SAILS THE CLIPBOARD i the hallway.  Melina lets go of Edgemar's hand -- There is a TREMENDOUS EXPLOSION in the hallway,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail comes out in crouch, ready to shoot.  On the floor lies a DEAD MAN and the body of the Shoeshine Boy, sprawl grotesquely.  The hallway is filled with smoke.  The floo covered with debris.  Plaster falling from the ceiling. All over the hotel, ALARMS begin BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail strides back in, icy-furious.  He seizes Melina by the wrist and drags her after him into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more E.I.O. men appear but Quail shoots them while dragging Melina down the hall in the opposite direction. He pushes open the door leading to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina run down the stairs.  On the next landin is a service elevator, from which a waiter is emerging carefully carrying a tray with hors d'oeuvres and champag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you prefer your order in your room, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail bundles the waiter unceremoniously back inside the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail presses the basement button.  As he talks to Melina he opens the champagne and pours two glasses.  The waiter is too frightened to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Answers!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kidnapped me.  Said they'd kill you if I didn't cooperate.  I told them I didn't care, but then when I realized they meant it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why they're after me, but what's your connection with all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were together before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I'm really sorry I can't recall the details of that encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator has reached the basement.  They rush out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina run from a basement door into an alley. A solar car whips out in front of them.  Quail and Melina leap aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Bennie, for God's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie weaves as fast as he can in and out of the traffic Quail and Melina ducking out of view in the passenger sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances in mirror) Bad news, boss lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black cruiser just pull out behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large gas-powered official-looking car is pushing its w through the crowds and traffic behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail is aiming his gun at the following car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the shooter, boss.  I lose 'em for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose them?  In this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie reaches down, grasps a KNOB.  He yanks it, like someone starting an outboard motor -- and an ear-splittin LOUD ENGINE roars to life. Bennie opens the throttle and the solar car HURTLES DOWN THE STREET.  Quail and Melina are thrown back in the seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE blazes all around the car.  Quail FIRES back at the pursuing car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts over GUNFIRE) You're gonna get a ticket for that engine, Bennie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yutani 650 -- you like it, boss?  Nothing like the old gas when you want a bit of speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS from the cruiser rip through the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better have two aces, Bennie. (glances behind) There's a second cruiser -- and it's gaining --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie's car hurtles through the crowds with the official car gaining on it.  Bennie takes a corner sharply near a huge water selling stand.  The official car brakes to mak the same turn, but clips the side of the water stand.  Th water container tips and empties water through the open roof (i.e. through which one of the Agents has been firin so that the car completely fills.  The driver continues t chase, but the occupants are now submerged.  They frantic ally open the windows while continuing to follow Bennie's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The solar car rushes down what appears to be a dead-end street, with the official vehicle (water pouring out of the windows) in pursuit. At the end of the street, however, Bennie doesn't stop bu continues going into a large opening.  It is an abandoned mine.  The bigger car follows him, but won't fit.  The roof is smashed to pieces as the vehicle is wedged into the narrow opening. The second official car pulls up behind.  A chauffeur jum out and opens the rear door.  Cohaagen steps out.  He sur veys the scene.  The four men in the wrecked car clamber their way backwards out of the wreckage.  They are covere in blood and their clothes are in shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it, then, you've failed to get him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cohaagen turns to an associate, EMILE, a youngish, well-dressed executive type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Proceed with Operation Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With him... (gestures toward the mine) ...on the lose, I'm not taking any more chances. Operation Sphinx will flush him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The solar car proceeds along the tunnel.  It enters an ar full of smoke.  Dozens of men are sitting around smoking cigarettes, pipes and cigars.  Quail looks at them in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin', boss.  Just old smokies.  Only place they can come for a puff.  It's all banned topside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have now climbed out of the car.  Quail looks searchingly at Melina and Bennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you two are into something a bit more serious than the taxi and truck-stop business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unzips his jacket to reveal a T-shirt with "MARTIAN LIBERATION FRONT" (and an appropriate symbol) emblazoned on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!... T-shirts.  They died out on Earth years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) Well, maybe we ain't fashion leaders, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But we still believe in a free Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk as they talk - into a room off the main tunnel. It is adorned with "FREE MARS" and "MARTIAN LIBERATION FRONT" posters.  A group of people are printing T-shirts and leaflets.  They exchange greetings with Melina and Bennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where did I fit into all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You - when you were Charles Hauser with E.I.O - infiltrated our group.  I guess Cohaagen didn't trust you any more when you and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her gesture suggests their liaison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  And I can't even remember it.  We'll have to arrange a return bout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so he had your memory wiped and fixed you up with a new identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But - the Sphinx.  Why is that stuck in my mind?  Why's it so important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an ole heap o' stone, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than that, Bennie, I know it's more.  Somehow it's connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slumps into a chair with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflecting) Maybe there's a way  you can get your memory back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  What?  Where?  When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit of Martian Wisdom. We're not all stupid colonists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie, Quail and Melina are walking in a crowded area of town.  Water sellers and food stalls are everywhere. An ARMORED LOUDSPEAKER VEHICLE appears, broadcasting to the crowd.  It is also swinging a powerful searchlight along the footpaths and streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all residents are to report to their nearest space-travel agent within twelve hours, all residents will be departing on shuttles within twenty-four hours.  Air and water supplies will be cut off at that time.  I repeat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearing everyone out!  It's been rumored for months...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The searchlight approaches Bennie, Quail and Melina.  Ben ducks into a doorway, while Quail grabs Melina and kisses her passionately.  The light sees only the back of his he She responds warmly to his kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  I can see why I was willing to betray E.I.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I though you believed in our cause?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Of course.  That, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into the crowd.  The message on the loudspeaker is repeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the room is an amazing contrast to its ghetto exterior.  The decor is a baroque combination of Middle Eastern opulence and 21st century flash.  It looks like something out of "The Arabian Nights". A man enters from another room.  Although the man's featu are East Indian, he is very much a Peter Lorre type;  he wears a small fez cap and a white linen robe with a cowl draped around the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to Quail) Your servant, Fahreem Kuato. I greet you by the twenty-seven names that still remain, praying that you cast jewels into the darkness and given them to glow with the colors of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kuato speaks, Quail, unimpressed, talks, sotto voce, to Melina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What use is this weirdo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssssh...there are skills on mars that Earth has forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to introduce yourself, Mr. Quail. (smiles at Quail's surprise) Tolerate my presumption, but it does not tax my powers to know that you are the most sought-after man on two worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the street the sound of loudspeakers giving informat about Quail and Co. can be heard.  Searchlight beams occasionally sweep past the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This way, my dear man.  We have much to accomplish -- (ominously) -- and very little time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bysantine salon filled with enormous Oriental pillows. (NOTE:  In the scenes inside Kuato's sanctum, the loudspe vans in the outside streets can be heard from time to to time.  They are repeating the evacuation message from scene 99, but alternating it with a call for the apprehension of Quail and Melina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for information leading to these arrests, first-class travel to Earth will be provided plus a weekend at the Leningrad Disneyworld, all expenses paid.  I repeat, an Oriental girl and Earthman, possibly to be found in the company of a black taxi driver. These are dangerous subversives and sworn enemies of the glorious Peoples Republic of Mars...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbulence you hear outside is but a reflection of the turmoil within you. You have brought it to Mars in your search for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuato takes a seat on the pillows, invites the others to join him.  Quail hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're going to help me by reading my mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indubitably.  There is only small matter of a fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for our cause!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothingly) Income before ideals.  Shall we say five-hundred-thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) Five-hundred-thousand Martian dollars, that's... (think, calculating the exchange rate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Martian dollars, Mr. Quail - Earth dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interplanetary robbery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With today's exchange rate... that's over two million Martian dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suave) What price do you put, Mr. Quail, on the future of the solar system?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come off it, man.  Just for a bit of mumbo-jumbo with a crystal ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his manner slipping) Listen, buster, we're talking heavy stuff here.  You try and work out what's with this guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks his thumb toward Quail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Okay!  I'll pay it, but the Interstellar Trade Practices Commission might be interested in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone calms down. Kuato smiles.  He extinguishes all the lights save one small blue one, which illuminates the room eerily, like a seance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retrieving the past is like walking backwards along a perilous road.  The half-recalled, the half-forgotten, the repressed, the fantasies, the triumphs, joys, failures, betrayals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes and concentrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yes... I can feel it... a wall.  Erasure techniques are so brutal. (frowns; scans harder) Blocks.  Side channels. Future and past all jumbled. I shall have to enter deep trance to break through. (rising) I will be scanning you through the Oracle Head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kauto turns around and sits down with back toward Quail. He reaches up and lowers his cowl, REVEALING:

dialogues.speaker: A TINY LITTLE HEAD GROWING OUT OF THE BACK OF HIS NECK
dialogues.text: The head's eyes are closed in sleep.  It is utterly hairl and looks like one of those dolls made from dried apples; shriveled, ancient-looking yellow little ball. The LITTLE FACE TWITCHED, YAWNS and OPENS ITS EYES, BLINK It looks at Melina, then at Quail. It opens its toothless little mouth and SPEAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not fear me.  I need your openness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Open you thoughts to my presence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUE ZOOM UNTIL ENTIRE FRAME is filled by QUAIL'S EYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Open...

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS BROKEN BY PULSES OF WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: The alternations between dark (ACTION) and white (LIGHT) are RHYTHMICAL so as to create a hypnotic, dream-like feeling.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LIGHT
dialogues.text: Fades to reveal a dramatic CLOSE UP of the SPHINX.  We se its face, shoulders and behind it the red Martian sky --

dialogues.speaker: 103A PULL BACK
dialogues.text: to reveal the Sphinx is a PROJECTION on a screen in a windowless briefing room.  Quail is seated across from Cohaagen and other SENIOR E.I.O. OFFICERS.  On the walls are numerous satellite photos, recon maps and excavation drawings -- all relating to the Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scaffolding and excavation works cover a wall of the Sphi the Sphinx's huge CARVED FACE visible in the background. Quail and several other E.I.O. agents stand poised, weari breathing masks and protective gear, as a powerful excavation device prizes back a huge stone, revealing an ENTRANCE TO SOME KIND OF HIDDEN CHAMBER. The other agents are fearful, don't want to proceed.  Qua ignores them, enters the chamber --

dialogues.speaker: QUAIL'S FACE
dialogues.text: As he enters.  We read awe, shock and fascination on his features.  He approaches something we can't see.  His hand reaches out. Suddenly, a bolt of incredible powerful energy flashes ou striking Quail like a bolt of lightning. WHITE LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina are dancing.  The faceted mirror ball on the ceiling become the -- WHITE LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina watches from the bed as Quail dresses.  She rises, with only the sheet around her, tries desperately to make Quail stay.  Plainly he wants to, but he can't.  They kis lingeringly;  then Quail, as if "called to duty," exits. WHITE LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail alone, hands bound, in a holding chamber.  Suddenly the door opens and THREE BEEFY E.I.O. AGENTS enter.  They grab Quail to haul him out.  Quail battles them with amazing skill and resourcefulness.  With his bound hands he SLUGS ONE MAN, hurling him into a wall;  he RABBIT- PUNCHES a second man with a two-handed blow and KNOCKS HIM UNCONSCIOUS.  The third man sneaks around behind Quail and DROPS HIM WITH A BLACKJACK to the back of the head. WHITE LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail on his back, all four limbs pinned by some futurist version of "the rack," his head held imobile by a FEARSOM DEVICE similar to the one we glimpsed on Earth, in the va the two agents tried to shove him into. Several DOCTORS stand over him.  INTO FRAME moves... Cohaagen! Cohaagen orders the doctors to attach electrodes to PROBE already inserted into Quail's brain.  As they turn up the power, Quail's face contorts in a grimace of agony --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have seen your past. Now read the future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same scene we saw during the film's OPENING SEQUENCE. A man wearing a LIGHT-WEIGHT THERMAL SUIT races through a LABYRINTH OF TUNNELS.  The GROUND TREMBLES beneath him, a if in an earthquake.  EXPLOSIONS rumble deep in the groun below him.  Suddenly we realize -- the man is Quail

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE
dialogues.text: He throws a backward glance over his shoulder, fearfully, as he runs.  Suddenly a BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT floods in from ahead of him;  he puts up his hands to protect his eyes -- and sees his hands are SPLATTERED WITH BLOOD! Quail runs even faster -- ahead the BRILLIANT LIGHT seems to promise safety.  He battles toward it.  SOUNDS OF EXPLOSIONS increase, building urgency.  Up ahead, emergin from the light, HANDS REACH OUT TO HELP QUAIL.  He seems almost to safety.  But just as he REACHES THE HANDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail awakens with a jolt.  White as a sheet... sweating like he's just run ten miles.  Then:  a transformation seems to come over him.  He LOOKS -- and SEES: KUATO slumped across the cushions -- MELINA beside Kuato BENNIE standing holding a smoking GUN trained on Kuato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes to Quail) Charles!  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail stares at her, as if an entire bank of lost memorie were suddenly clicking back into place --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He kept dragging you deeper and deeper into the trance! We couldn't wake either of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stopped breathing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail gives Bennie that same eerie look, then turns to Kuato, who is sprawled motionless across the pillows, a curl of smoke rising from two entry wounds in his spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you kill him?  It was the next bit I really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No choice, boss.  It was him or you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail lunges across the pillows to Kuato's unbreathing form.  Quail shakes the ancient mystic, trying to find a last flicker of life. Kuato's body is dead white.  Quail releases his grip; he about to give up when -- A MUFFLED CHOCKED SOUND comes from behind Kuato's neck. It's the Oracle Head!  Quail instantly rolls Kuato's body over.  The Head is still alive! Quail bends closer, kneeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) -- the vengence you seek... and the salvation of Mars... are waiting for you in the crown of the Sphinx. (sags, gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oracle Head lets out a LONG SIGH and goes limp, a small trickle of blood oozing from the corner of its mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phobos and Demos!  What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail ignores him, still kneeling -- deep in thought -- over the Oracle Head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?... Charles? Doug?  Whoever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail reaches out and closes the Oracle Head's tiny eyelids.  Melina and Bennie exchange a glance.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: QUAIL
dialogues.text: Stands.  For a moment his back is to Melina and Bennie. Then he turns. He has become a different man.  His eyes gleam.  He is forceful, purposeful, contained.  Once again the ace E.I. agent.  Melina senses immediately that this is the man sh knew before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even his voice has changed) I'm fine... only I'm not Doug -- I'm Charles Hauser... and I know everything Hauser knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Bennie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bennie, where's your depot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working it out) Well... you go outta here... take a left, then down past the first... no second... water bureau you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (briskly) Can you get us there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides off.  The others follow, still full of questio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible, man.  Guards everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oracle... what did you learn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only everything.  I've got total recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now heading down the stairs toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail, Melina and Bennie make their way through the crowd to Bennie's depot.  The streets are even busier then befo people are now beginning to evacuate the city.  Everyone carrying their possessions - bundles, suitcases, pets, et etc.  The loudspeaker vans are still touring and broad- casting the same message. Bennie indicates a building on their left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie and Melina follow Quail as he walks up and down th rows of vehicles in the vast building.  There are bull- dozers and ore haulers as well as solar taxis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never get near the Sphinx!  They'll blow us apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail ignores him as he continues to mumble to himself. He rapidly but carefully inspects each vehicle as they pass.  Camera tracks rapidly with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing, Charles? For God's sake, tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sphinx... it's not some useless artifact, it's a machine built by some alien race eighteen millions years ago.  The same race that built the on one Earth... for the same purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops in front of a large, odd-shaped vehicle with a large scoop or propeller on the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is what we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to climb in;  the others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the Sphinx) It's a hunk of old stone, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ditto) Purpose?  What purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bennie, move it. (then, to Melina) Have you heard the word, "terriform"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina shakes her head.  The vehicle moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS are carefully checking every vehicle leaving the city, though this has to be done fairly rapidly because of the inhabitants leaving for the Space Ports. The vehicle with Bennie, Quail and Melina arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie is nervous.  Melina and Quail are in the back, but cannot be seen.  Guards are checking all vehicles exiting looking for Quail and Melina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Guards) Just deliverin' some old junk to the mine out at Apidalia Planitia.  Got them people you're lookin' for in the back as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards laugh and signal him on. Once through the second door of the air lock (i.e. to the area outside the city), Quail and Melina emerge and sit up on the rear seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine in the Sphinx is tapped straight down to the molten core of this planet. There are tunnels and ducts everywhere, all powered by fusion generators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure the little man didn't fry your brain, Quail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) For what?  To do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To combine elements in the Martian core and release them as oxygen, hydrogen and nitrogen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a wide shot, the vehicle is traversing the desert.  Th domed city is some distance in the background.  Voices ar heard in false perspective.  Emphasis is on the dry and hostile natural landscape of Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Air and water. Terriforming will create a permanent livable environment for Mars.  No more pressurized cities, no more containers in the desert.  There'll be rivers, vegetation - life - the same as Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled) So why is Cohaagen shipping everyone out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?!  From being a pile of red dirt with minerals, Mars is going to change into  a chunk of priceless real estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cohaagen's going to own it all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!  He can start selling it off to well-heeled investors from Earth.  Beach condos, ski resorts, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder he wanted you to... penetrate... out group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Once word of this gets out, the whole planet will support you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle is now approaching the Sphinx.  Both it and the pyramids can be seen some distance away. Voice are heard in CU perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruin his little scheme by terriforming ahead of schedule - while the inhabitants are still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who'll work the machine? Do you know how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only one who does. Why do you think Cohaagen's left me alone all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle is even closer to the Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the first one inside when they cracked the riddle of the Sphinx.  It must've been programmed.  Some kind of...force...shot into me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cohaagen wiped your memory!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smoothly) Just a way of putting me on ice.  He'd of reversed it once the planet was evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man!  This is real complicated. Go over it again, real slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Bennie's aside) What he hadn't counted on was your effect on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) And all without the marvels of modern science!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail looks out the back window, his attention attracted by two patrol vehicles.  They are some distance away, but approaching steadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide shot shows a total of four patrol vehicles approac ing the vehicle with Quail, Melina and Bennie.  Suddenly, it stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle had just stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie, don't stop now, take it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see Bennie is covering him and Melina with a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said.  It's a tough planet.  I'm a baddie, not a goodie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known, you were just too helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIO Rule One, man.  Trust Nobody.  Now you can do your terriforming stuff right when those space shuttles are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the Martian people?  Out cause?  I thought you believed in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cause?  That bunch of dead beat radicals!  When I hand in this little number... (flicks his gun in Quail's face) ...I'll get real estate rights on the whole of Chryse Planitia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, Melina lunges, PUNCHES A RED EMERGENCY BUTTON.  The VENT beside Bennie's hand BLOWS OPEN, [causi a powerful suction caused by Mars's vacuum atmosphere. Bennie's gun hand is PLANTED AGAINST THE VENT [OPENING.] Simultaneously, the air in the vehicle starts rushing out All three parties begin choking.  As Bennie's mechanical hand claws for the lever that seals the vent, Quail has a moment to jump him.  He pounds Bennie's gun hand, the

dialogues.speaker: PISTOL IS SUCKED, CLATTERING, OUT THE VENT
dialogues.text: Quail delivers a roundhouse punch to Bennie, knocking him clear across the bus. Melina seals the vent, REPRESSURIZES THE CABIN. Bennie gets up off the floor, shaking off Quail's punch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.I.O. vehicle are a half mile off -- and closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail glances at the vehicles, turns to Bennie -- ready to jump him.  But stops short at what he sees Bennie doin Bennie is clipping on his MECHANICAL ARM.  It sprouts several rows of vicious-looking STEEL BLADES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Bennie a cut above anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie presses another button and the BLADES START SPINNI Bennie's mechanical arm is in effect now a BUZZ SAW! The fight begins.  Bennie attacks Quail with his buzz-saw arm;  Quail dodges.  Bennie's arm shreds various articles in the cabin -- and keeps Melina at bay with well-timed swipes.  Finally Bennie gets in a roundhouse punch to Quail's jaw with his real hand.  Quail sprawls, dazed. Now Bennie goes for the kill.  But Melina leaps onto him. Bennie grabs her by the hair and moves his SPINNING HAND in for the quick kill.  Melina clutches the terrifying appendage with both hands, desperately keeping it at bay. But her strength is no match for Bennie; the whirring blades are just about to bite into Melina's neck when -- Quail comes back, lands a ferocious rabbit punch to Bennie's spine.  Quail lunges at him, grabs the blade weapon;  he and Bennie crash into the cabin wall and -- The BLADE RIPS CLEAR THROUGH THE MOLE'S WALL!  Alarms sound as a GAPING HOLE IS BLOWN IN THE SIDE OF THE

dialogues.speaker: VACUUM
dialogues.text: Now no one can breathe.  They all claw for their masks, [still] in place.  Bennie is first;  he recovers, lunges with his SPINNING ARM for Quail.  Quail barely dodges, grabs the arm, muscles it back toward Bennie -- The SPINNING BLADES SEVER BENNIE'S OWN OXYGEN LINE!  Gasp ing, he falters.  Quail aims a titanic blow, PUNCHES BENNIE out through the hole in the mole's wall! Quail and Melina, masks on, stare out as Bennie claws desperately at his severed air line.  The Martian vacuum pulls the oxygen from Bennie's lungs, he chokes, staggers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennie is beside the vehicle.  He implodes like a balloon with all its air gone.

dialogues.speaker: 122AB INT/EXT. VEHICLE
dialogues.text: Melina hides her face in horror.  At that instant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets dig into the sand all around the vehicle.  The patrol cars are only a few hundred yards away!  Loud- speakers call for Quail's surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail lunges for the vehicle controls.  Presses a button marked "Dive".  The vehicle tilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle burrows powerfully into the sand.  As the patrol cars close in and rake the desert with gunfire, the vehicle vanishes from sight.  In the distance, the Sphinx looms ominously. A driver in one of the patrol vehicles (filmed from outsi the windscreen) is speaking into a microphone.  He can't be heard but can only be radioing a report.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND
dialogues.text: The little mining vehicle moves powerfully, propelled by its BORER NOSE. Quail mans the controls while Melina struggles to shore u the gaping hole in the side, into which SAND is POURING as the mole moves forward.  Quail looks at a compass in the control panel.  He makes a correction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts over engine noise) Hope I've got this direction right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand pours over him from bullet holes resulting from the encounter with patrol cars. CU speedometer:  22 MPH.  Every other gauge is overheatin flashing WARNING LIGHTS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cohaagen and a number of his associates, plus scientists and heavily arms troops are present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air supply is off under the domes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  In a couple of hours it'll be all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any trouble with the rabble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, sir.  A lot of complaining.  But they're all heading towards the shuttle areas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On some of the video screens a number of space shuttles can be seen, ready for departure to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mole bores through a sand wall, emerges into a crampe horizontal tunnel.  Quail and Melina leap out.  The poor Mole is smoking like an overheated drill bit.  Its nose is worn to a nub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got in with this thing, but we'll never get back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shame.  Such a pleasant trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lighted area at the end of the tunnel.  Quail and Melina hurry toward it, moving silently, close to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They draw up an abyss -- where their tunnel intersects th MAIN DOWNSHAFT.  Melina gasps at the colossal scale of th drilling, hundreds of yards across, deeper than the eye can see, and crisscrossed by catwalks, buttresses and super-sophisticated technology. Quail and Melina are forty feet below the upper end of the main downshaft.  They can look up the shaft and see the first interior level of the Sphinx itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points down shaft) This is the main tap -- straight down to the core of Mars.  When we trigger the mechanism, fusion reactors will detonate down there -- four hundred miles deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me not to slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new elements will come booming up through this shaft -- and six thousand others all around the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right at home -- and full of confidence. Quail climbs onto the ladder, which links various top levels. He starts to climb.  Melina follows him.  They are tiny figures.  The space around them plummets down to infinity

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patrol of NINE HEAVILY-ARMED GUARDS appear from a corri in Level One -- directly above where Quail and Melina are climbing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WALL OF THE SHAFT
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina's heads inch into view at floor level. They take one peek at these formidable warriors and duck back swiftly out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to two of his men) Stay in contact.  I want to hear from this checkpoint every four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven of the Guards move off, two remain in position. We HEAR the FOOTSTEPS of the seven guards recede. The two remaining guards realize their isolation; they glance tensely to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Guard points to the edge  of the main shaft -- right where Quail and Melina are hiding.  The Guards cock their weapons, start cautiously forward.  Just as they're about to peer over the brink, guns at the ready:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind the guards) I'm not there, boys.  I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards spin around, weapons poised.  Standing in the shadows, near the corridor, is Quail!  (Still with no gun) Both guards walk quickly toward Quail, covering him with their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Guard #2) Watch him.  He was EIO trained. They're all full of tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Like...who was that guy? -- Fred Bond?? (to Quail) Keep 'em up, Fred, keep 'em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail has his arms raised high.  Just as the Guards reach him, he fizzes electronically, emitting a humming sound, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hologram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before either Guard can react, the real Quail appears -- one foot behind them.  With two LIGHTNING BLOWS, he dispatches the Guards.  (Apparently Quail has climbed out of the shaft while the Guards were distracted.) Quail snatches both Guards' weapons, grenades and ammo belts.  Melina climbs out of the shaft.  Quail tosses her one of the Guard's guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS go off everywhere.  Quail -- carrying a gun and al the grenades and ammo belts -- and Melina (just carrying gun) bolt down a corridor past a sign: "LEVEL ONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running) Where'd you get that little trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running) Mail-order company.  It's a great one for fooling the wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cohaagen and his Aides hear the ALARMS, see Quail and Melina on MONITORS as they race down the corridor on Level One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did they get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the fusion core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the fusion core??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exhibits begrudging admiration for Quail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studies monitor more carefully) They're on Level One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall sign behind Cohaagen reads:  "LEVEL THIRTEEN".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal all upper levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A button is pressed and huge doors slide across in front of the formidable doors already closing the Control Room off from the outside corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina are still racing through the corridors. He passes her a fresh ammo belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates weapons) Know how to use one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina expertly ejects her spent clip (that Guards fired at Quail), slams in a fresh clip and cocks the gun. Quail has a half-second to react, impressed, then -- FOUR GUARDS pound into view at the end of the corridor. Melina opens fire, nails two.  Quail heaves a grenade; as it EXPLODES, he and Melina bolt down a side corridor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS continue as Quail and Melina dash down the side passageway.  MORE GUARDS cut them off;  Melina's machine gun sends them scattering -- Quail pauses at a corner.  He looks around quickly and se that an elevator is arriving.  He motions Melina back.  T doors of the elevator begin to open.  Very quickly, Quail bobs his head and arm around the corner.  He calls out, loudly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls something toward the armed men in the elevator. Instinctively one of them reaches for the thrown object. It is an explosive device of some sort.  Quail and Melina press themselves against the wall just around a corner fr the elevator.  There is a tremendous explosion. Quail, followed by Melina, rounds a corner.  The elevator is in ruins; bodies are scattered everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great stuff, but how do we get up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points toward the upper levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina and Quail can be seen on the security monitor from a high angle.  Quail looks up, spots the monitor, and shoots is to pieces.  The image on the screen goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget them.  We'll pick up Quail once the shuttles have left for Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail spots a large WINDOWED AIR LOCK at the end of the corridor.  He and Melina race to it.  Quail starts to ope the inner door of the air lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're afraid of the heights, you better get over it real quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is pulling Melina through the inner air lock door just as -- GUARDS stampede around the corner of the corridor toward them. Quail is out of sight, but they see Melina poised near th window.  She waves and smiles to them, hiding her gun beh her body.  They slow down and approach less cautiously, beguiled by her manner and attractiveness.  As they get close, she suddenly lifts her gun and opens fire, mowing them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina climb through the outer air lock door. They are at the Sphinx's shoulder, with a dizzying drop beneath them.  Melina looks down.  She's sorry she did: the fall is at least 200 feet.  (Both are wearing their breathing apparatus.) Quail and Melina start to climb.  Up the Sphinx's shoulde along its Egyptian-like headdress --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cohaagen's chief aide, Emile, addresses him quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Quail's the only one who can operate all this... (gestures toward Sphinx's controls) ...then he can call all the shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll tell him the computer's worked out the operational details so we don't really need him.  We're just doing him a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if that doesn't work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We offer him rewards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if that doesn't work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll torture him.  You don't think I got this far by being a nice guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail and Melina traverse across the cheekbones, haul themselves up at the base of the red translucent eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video monitors show the space shuttles.  An operator, with earphones, turns to Cohaagen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of the shuttles ready for departure, sir.  Two minute countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail jams THREE GRENADES against the glass of the eyes, pulls Melina back behind the stone cheeks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MUFFLED EXPLOSION (due to the thin Martian atmosphere) detonates overhead.  THE SPHINX'S RIGHT EYE BLOWS IN a storm of shards and shrapnell. Instantly, the room turns into a hurricane as the Martian vacuum sucks out all air!  Everyone panics, grabbing thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal the breach!  Repressurize!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aide dives for an EMERGENCY SWITCH.  But now -- Quail and Melina, wearing breather masks, bursts in onto an overhead catwalk.  They OPEN FIRE on the Guards, who a choking, struggling with their masks. An EMERGENCY PRESSURE SEAL powers into place, sealing the breach in the eye.  REPRESSURIZATION comes up, the intern atmosphere stabilizes -- None of the men inside the control room still moves.  The victors tug off their masks, spring down to the main leve Melina hurries to the main control panel. Melina looks towards the video monitors showing half a dozen huge space shuttles lined up for departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those shuttles are starting up any minute.  If you know how to work this thing, you better do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail tentatively approaches the imposingly complex machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfixed, mesmerized, Quail moves closer to the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... there's a vital connection missing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches even closer.  He begins to raise his arm towards a blank area a little above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you activate the mechanism you'll die...there were glimpses of it in your memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, Cohaagen, there's a long tunnel, a brilliant white light, hands reaching for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (assured) That's your death.  That's what it looks like.  That's what is always looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail looks around him, half-convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking toward space shuttles on video screens) Charles - for Mars's sake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail hesitates.  He looks from Melina to Cohaagen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late.  Join us again.  U've a lot to offer. A whole world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quail continues to look at him, thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't deserve a new world, you and people like you made too big a mess of the old one. Time someone else had a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the machine and slowly raises his arm again.  His fingers reach towards the blank section on the panel.  Slowly, through the panel, a luminous hand reaches toward Quail's fingers.  Gently, the fingers of the two hands touch. The entire control room begins to rumble and shudder.  As Quail reaches for Melina, Cohaagen suddenly dives on him. They grapple amid the shuddering Sphinx and can be seen only intermittently as debris crashes around them. The fight ends as Cohaagen is hurled backwards and disappears when a section of floor collapses underneath h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reprise of the sequence that opened the movie. Quail RUNS THROUGH A LABYRINTH OF TUNNELS.  THE GROUND

dialogues.speaker: HEAVES BENEATH HIM ... HUGE STONE BLOCKS CRASH DONW ON
dialogues.text: ALL SIDES!  We hear an EXPLOSION and ANOTHER and ANOTHER, each one SOUNDING CLOSER than the last -- Quail clamps him breathing mask on as he runs.  Is this his own death?  Where is Melina? The tunnel walls are just like the ones in Quail's original nightmare -- bright reddish-orange, clay and quartz. Quail throws a backward glance fearfully over his shoulde The EXPLOSIONS are closer.  Suddenly -- Up ahead appears a BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT.  Quail sees it, but it only terrifies him more.  Is it death he's running to?  He hurries on with all his strength, but -- Just as he nears the white light, HE FALLS.  On his knees too weak to move.  He struggles -- HANDS ARE REACHING OUT TO HIM, from out of the brilliant light.  Quail stretches for them, just as -- A FINAL EXPLOSION blows him forward -- straight into the WHITE LIGHT!  The HANDS SEIZE HIM, pull him upward to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands belong to breather-masked MINERS, dismounting rapidly from an overloaded transport vehicle which was taking them to the Space Port.  Quail looks from them to Melina, who is walking towards the group.

dialogues.speaker: MINERS' MASKED FACES
dialogues.text: The miners' desert garb, shield goggles and breathers add to the surreal nightmare quality of Quail's tortured perspective --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO QUAIL
dialogues.text: In terror, lost, disoriented totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't lie to you, pal. You are. MINER (from Melina's bar) I'd say in about forty years... (he and others help Quail to his feet) ...come on, we've gotta get to the Space Port.  That Intergalactic Napoleon's switched off the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shippin' us all out.  Mars is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MINER'S WIFE watches them.  She is crying. Quail looks up at the sky.  Melina follows his glance. So do the others. Slowly, but perceptibly, the color is changing from yello to blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the miners are puzzled, apprehensive.  Quail reaches toward the one who spoke to him before and pulls off his breathing apparatus.  At first the man is shocked, then realizes he can breathe without it.  Quail takes off his own, then Melina's All the miners watch in amazement.  They all remove their breathing masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the start.  Next there'll be rain and growth and ... life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Rekall could never have come up with anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melina looks oddly at him, smiling, mysterious. As the sky becomes more and more blue, more of the Miners descend from the bus.  Softly at first, then with more an more confidence, they begin singing the Martian National Anthem. The music swells.  Quail puts his arm around Melina.  The both join in the chorus. It reaches an impassioned crescendo as the FRAME FREEZES and the END CREDITS ROLL UP the screen. THE END
